BE it enacted by the Queen’s Most Excellent ° Majesty, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate and the House of Representatives of Ceylon in in this present Parliament assembled, and by the authority of the same, as follows :—
4. This Act may be cited as the Public Service ‘her tt, Provident Fund (Amendment) Act, No. 33 of 1952. :

2. Section 18 of the Public Service Provident Fund Amepdmentot Ordinance, No. 18 of 1949, (hereinofter referred to as Scisnme the “' prinoipal enactment”), is hereby amended a ™® 18 of 196. follows :—
(a) by the renumbering of that section as . sab-section {1) of section 18;
(8) by the insertion after the re-numbered sub-section (1), of the following new sub-section :—
. _ *@) ‘Where contributor to the Fund 4s appointed to a pensionable ofc in the public service and enters on the duties of such office, then, notwithstanding that his
: service as a scheduled employes is not continuous with his service in the pension-
able office, the provisions of sub-section (1)
shall apply if, but only if -

(a) his service as a scheduled employee is terminated by resignation made’ with the consent of the prescribed affcer or authority given for the purpose of enabling him to accept the pensionable office; and

(8) the period intervening between the date of the termination of his service as » scheduled employee and the date of his entering on the duties of the pensionable office is nob more than thirty.one days exclusive of any, period daring which he is actually being train for each office:
